radiographic_examinations.findings: Markedly advanced bone age at 9.0 years for a chronologic age of 5 years and 2 months.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Bone age has remained advanced approximately 4 years above chronologic age on repeat assessments.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal with no signs of skeletal dysplasia.
Advanced bone age of 13 years and 0 months.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat assessments during treatment confirmed that GnRH agonist treatment successfully blocked bone age advancement.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Detected multiple osteochondral lesions along the weight-bearing parts of the medial femoral condyles consistent with osteochondritis dissecans.
